bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. Kidwell, August 12, 1937

div1.p: Hench sends a check for the Yellow Fever Commission report and requests two more copies.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. Kidwell, August 12, 1937
div1.opener:
August 12, 1937
Mrs. Kidwell
United States Government Printing Office
Washington, D. C.
Dear Mrs. Kidwell:
div1.p:
Inclosed you will find a check
for forty-five cents, which I am sending you on
the instruction of Mr. Alton P. Tisdell, for a
copy of Senate Document 922, 61st Congress, 3d Session,
The Report of the Yellow Fever Commission. I am
delighted indeed to be able to find a copy of this
publication and wonder whether you have other copies.
If so, I should like to buy two more. If you will
send these to me, I will promptly remit.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
